resources:
Moonlight Moonlight (Root)
PC deleted Unpaired PC PC not found Provided PC not valid Provided app not valid
Help Viewer Loading help page…
Online Offline Refreshing… View All Apps Pair with PC Unpair Send Wake-On-LAN request Delete PC Test Network Connection View Details
Testing Network Connection… <string name="nettest_text_waiting"Testing network connection to determine if NVIDIA GameStream is blocked… Network Test Complete Moonlight is not blocked by the network. Check your PC\'s firewall settings if you have trouble connecting.\n\nTo stream over the Internet, install the Moonlight Internet Hosting Tool on your PC and run the included Internet Streaming Tester. Could not reach any of Moonlight\'s connection testing servers to thest the network conenction. Check it yourself, or try again later. The network settings on your device is blocking Moonlight. Change them or use a different network to stream over the Internet.\n\nThe following network ports were blocked:\n The network your device is connected to is blocking Moonlight. Connect to a different network to stream over the Internet.
Pairing… Computer offline Computer currently in a game. Close it before pairing. Pairing Enter the following PIN on the target PC: Incorrect PIN Pairing failed Pairing already in progress…
Computer online Cannot wake PC because GFE didn\'t send a MAC address Waking PC… It may take your PC some seconds to wake up. If it doesn\'t, make sure Wake-On-LAN is set up on it.
Could not send Wake-On-LAN packets
Unpairing… Unpaired Could not remove pairing Could not pair device
Computer offline The ComputerManager service is not running. Wait a few seconds or restart the app. Could not resolve host Got a HTTP 404 error from GFE. Ensure your PC is running a supported GPU. Using remote desktop software can also cause this error. Try rebooting your machine or reinstall GFE.
Video Decoder Crashed Moonlight has an incompatibility with the video decoder on this device. Ensure GeForce Experience on your PC is updated to the latest version. Try adjusting the streaming settings if the problem persists. Video Settings Reset The video decoder on your devices still crashes at the selected streaming settings. They have been reset to their defaults. USB access is turned off on your device. Check your Knox or MDM settings. Your current launcher allow creating pinned shortcuts. Could not start video decoder. Your device may not support the selected resolution or frame rate. No video from host. Reduce your video bitrate setting or try a faster connection for better performance. There was a problem starting the stream on your host PC.\n\nEnsure you don\'t have any DRM-protected content open on it, or try restarting it.\n\nTry reinstalling your GPU drivers and GeForce Experience if the problem persists. Check your firewall and port forwarding rules for port(s):
Establishing Connection Starting connection… Warning: Your active network connection is not unlimited! Average frame decoding latency: hardware decoder latency: Average hardware decoding latency: Starting Connection Error Could not start Connection Terminated The connection was terminated
Public IP address of GeForce PC Searching for PCs with GameStream running…\n\n Ensure GameStream is on in the GeForce Experience SHIELD settings. Yes No Lost connection to PC Details Help Really delete this PC? Slow connection to PC\nReduce your bitrate Poor connection to PC Video stream: %1$s %2$.2f FPS Decoder: %1$s Incoming frame rate from network: %1$.2f FPS Rendering frame rate: %1$.2f FPS Frames dropped by your network connection: %1$.2f%% Average network latency: %1$d ms (variance: %2$d ms) Average decoding time: %1$.2f ms
Connecting to PC… Resume Session Quit Session Quit Current Game and Start Cancel View Details Create Shortcut Add to Channel Hide App App List Refreshing apps… Error Could not fetch app list Quitting Goodbye Could not quit Really quit the running app? All unsaved data will be lost. App ID:
Add PC Manually Connecting to the PC… Cannot connect to this computer. Ensure the required ports are open in the firewall. Computer added Cannot resolve PC address. Ensure the address is correct. Enter an IP address first Use the correct public IP address of your router to stream over the Internet.
Basic Video resolution Increase for better image clarity. Decrease for better performance on slow devices and networks. Native Resolution Warning GeForce Experience does not officially support native resolution modes, so it will not set your host display resolution. Set it manually in-game.\n\nRead NVIDIA\'s warning of possible monitor damage, PC instability, etc. before creating a custom resolution in NVIDIA Control Panel that matches your device resolution,.\n\n\nIt may not work at all for techincal reasons and Moonlight is not resonsible. Video frame-rate Increase for a smoother video. Decrease for better performance on slow devices. Video bitrate Increase for better image quality. Decrease to improve performance on slow connections. Mbps Stretch video to full-screen Native Native Full-Screen
Audio Surround sound setup 5.1 or 7.1 surround sound for home-theater systems
Input Use touchscreen as trackpad Makes the touchscreen act like a trackpad. Otherwise the touchscreen controls the cursor directly. Auto-detect gamepads Without this a gamepad must always be connected Emulate gamepad vibration Vibrates your device if your gamepad does not support it Analog stick deadzone adjustment % Xbox 360/One USB gamepad driver Uses a built-in driver on devices without Xbox controller support Override Xbox gamepad support Use Moonlight\'s driver for all supported gamepads, even if Xbox controllers are supported Mouse via gamepad Long pressing the \'Start'\ button switches the gamepad into mouse mode \'Back\' and \'Forward\' mouse buttons May break right-clicking on some devices Flip face buttons Switches A/B and X/Y for gamepads and on-screen controller
On-screen Controller Show on-screen controller Show virtual controller overlay on touchscreen Vibration Vibrates your device for the on-screen controller Only show L3 and R3 Hide all virtual buttons except L3 and R3 Clear saved on-screen controller layout Resets all on-screen controllers to default size and position Reset Layout Really delete saved on-screen controller layout? On-screen controller reset to default On-screen controller opacity Makes the on-screen controller less/more transparent Change opacity %
UI Picture-in-Picture observer mode Allows the stream to be viewed (but not controlled) while multitasking Language Language used in Moonlight Small box art More space in the app grid allows more apps to be visible
Host Optimize game settings Allow GFE to modify game settings for optimal streaming Play audio on PC Play audio from the computer and this device
Advanced Unlock all possible frame rates Streaming at 90 or 120 FPS may reduce latency on high-end devices and cause lag or instability on devices that can\'t handle it. No warning messages Turs off connection warning messages while streaming Never drop frames May reduce micro-stuttering on some devices, but can increase latency Change HEVC settings HEVC lowers video bandwidth requirements but requires a newer device HDR (Experimental) Stream HDR when the game and PC GPU support it. Requires a GTX 1000 series GPU or later. Performance stats while streaming Display real-time stream performance info when streaming Latency message after streaming Display a latency info message after the stream ends
